commit.message: Run flake8 after black has munged formatting.

Add an extract_zipkin_attrs_from_headers() helper

It turns out that extracting B3 headers correctly is harder than it
sounds.  This helper function implements the standard as specified at:
https://github.com/openzipkin/b3-propagation

You can pass a dict or dict-like object to the new
py_zipkin.request_helpers.extract_zipkin_attrs_from_headers()
function, and get back a ZipkinAttrs instance you can trust.

In some cases, a sample_rate float and a use_128bit_trace_id flag are
required, so they appear in the function signature as well.

This should take care of single-header extraction, which is part of
Issue #98.

This may help with Issue #73 (missing or empty X-B3-Sampled).

Merge pull request #145 from swiftstack/better-concurrent-subrequests

Provide a TracingThread subclass of threading.Thread

commit.message:
Adds better support for multiple Python (OS) threads

If you had a span context "open" and then ran code in multiple threads,
which themselves opened spans, they would end up as time-ordered
children of each other instead of all being sibling spans whose
parentIDs were all equal to the parent thread's span context's spanID.

You can now patch threading.Thread to work better by running
py_zipkin.instrumentations.python_threads.patch_threading().

Also added a function, py_zipkin.zipkin.has_default_trace() to
"non-destructively" probe whether a Tracer instance has been created.
Users of py_zipkin can use this to conditionalize code, but it is also
used by TracingThread to to nothing if an existing Trace instance
doesn't already exist.  In that case, each thread will get their own
local-root-spans, which I think is the correct behavior in that case.

In service of the above, Tracer and Stack classes now both have a copy()
method that does a deep-copy of the context stack.  I don't expect that
to get used outside of py_zipkin internals themselves.

NOTE: to get this PR to pass muster before the black changes merge, I
tweaked tox.ini and .pre-commit-config.yaml.  I'll clean that up after
the black PR merges.
need to give black a path otherwise it does nothing

commit.message:
Expose encoding.create_endpoint function

We currently import in py_zipkin/encoding/__init__.py and expose Span
and Endpoint. We should also include the create_endpoint helper since
that's the easiest way to create and initialize the Endpoint object.
